Greys

All contrast ratios assume a white (#FFF) background color.

Pattern 1 (Border Bottoms)
  • Pro: Can control underline weight
  • Con: Doesn't strikeout descenders, making it harder to read

Multiword

How it is I know not; but there is no place like a bed for confidential disclosures between friends. Man and wife, they say, there open the very bottom of their souls to each other; and some old couples often lie and chat over old times till nearly morning. Thus, then, in our hearts’ honeymoon, lay I and Queequeg—a cosy, loving pair.

Pattern 1.1 (Highly Accessible)
  • Pro: Reads better for users with dyslexia
  • Pro: Rules out any color contrast issues, because of underline
  • Pro: Best backwards compatibility
  • Con: Not very interesting

Pattern 1.2 ("Hipper")
  • Pro: Aesthetically more interesting
  • Con: Requires a very light crimson color to maintain contrast ratios

Pattern 1.3 (Icons)
  • Pro: Allows us to show different types of links: target (self, blank, etc.), download, disabled, mime/type (pdf, xls, etc)
  • Con: Icons can interrupt the flow of reading
  • Con: Hard to distinguish where links start and end
  • Con: Cannot use text-decoration underline because icon has to be displayed inline

Pattern 2 (Link w/ Icon & Button)
  • Pro: Looks clean
  • Pro: Could support link types like icons above
  • Con: Redundant links (not a deal breaker)
